techmeme.title: Ubisoft says its revenue for the nine months ending December 31, 2024 fell 31.4% YoY to €990M, with net booking down 34.8% to €944M, but is optimistic about Q4 (Sophie McEvoy/GamesIndustry.biz)
UK recasting its AI Safety Institute as AI Security Institute, with bias concerns cut out, came after JD Vance's speech criticizing "hand-wringing about safety" (Tom Bristow/Politico)
Sources: China's President Xi will chair a symposium on February 17 to boost private sector sentiment, with Tencent CEO Pony Ma and other tech execs attending (Reuters)
Sources: Mark Zuckerberg cozying up to President Trump has made employees uncertain and is part of an effort to shift antitrust scrutiny off Meta and onto Apple (Jonathan Vanian/CNBC)
The doge.gov website tracking Elon Musk's cuts to the federal government pulls from a database that anyone can edit, say two sources who found the vulnerability (Jason Koebler/404 Media)
